name: Request for an Arch Assassin build
author: webshaman1

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I am putting this character build together (I didn't find anything in the search).

Wizard/Monk/Assassin

Elf

This build is for WoG.

ATM, I am leaning towards Wiz 28/Monk 3/Assassin 9

All Int here - for a high PDA (Paralysing Death Attack) DC and for spells.

3 Monk for the Monk Speed as well as the Discipline skill drop and the synergy to get Assassin at level 6 (take Monk at level 5 for the Hide and MS requirement).

Should be able to dual-wield, so needs at least a 15 Dex - will need Ambidexterity combined with TWF and ITWF.

Will be taking 8 levels of Assassin and 1 Monk pre-Epic for 4 attacks/round (as well as getting Assassin at level 6).  1 Monk level in the 20s for a skill dump, and probably around level 37 or so (maybe level 40?) for high Disc.

Wisdom is not important - this build can use light armor - as on WoG, robes can be meh.  May go with Rary's Robes as they really help Wizards out.

It will rely on normal (buffed) Melee for m0bs, with spells for protection and AC (that cannot be dispelled with anything other than Mord's), has Wand creation (important on WoG), and has UMD and Tumble.  For Bosses, the PnP version of TT (Tensor's Transformation) combined with things like TS (Time Stop) and TS (True Strike) where needed.

The availability of virtually unlimited Impr. Invis (on a Wand, of course) makes this build on par with a Shadowdancer's HiPS on WoG, due to the Cooldown.

Assassin instead of Rogue to avoid an XP penalty as well.

I'm calling the build the Arch Assassin (just my personal peeve - you can call it whatever you like!)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
All this assassin talk..
What Webshaman posts here is a wizard 28 build. Everything else is an attempt to make it more melee-friendly.
The real question here is if it is worth it to only take 28 wizard levels.
3 monk levels give the speed feat, tumble, discipline, monk AC (If you want that) and monk attack progression if unarmed or with a Kama.
Assassin gives the poison feats, more 3/4 BAB class, most rogue skills, UMD if you need that with a wizard/monk, and a level 9 Improved invisibility (as if you need that with an epic wizard.) The Death attack DC with only 9 Assassin levels suffers even with a high intelligence buffed to the max.
My advice for this wizard build is: Do what wizards do best and cut down on the multiclassing to a minimum.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
It's a nice build, but it is weighted late (Assassin-wise) and doesn't include any Caster Class.

This mix that I am doing relies on the Monk "to hit" progression with dual wielded Kamas, non-dispellable magical protections (except for Mord's, but EMA and EW can't be dispelled and can be activated when Tensored).

With 4 normal attacks, plus 2 offhand, 1 extra for FoB, and 1 for Haste, that is pretty decent in and of itself!

But when DPed AND PnP TTed, woooooohoooooo!

It's pretty amazing!

That, plus using Inpr. Invis wands (self created) means the HS and MS are not really important, freeing up valuable skill points for Search and Spot (important, needed skills on WoG).

For really tough foes (WoG bosses) I am leaning on Gr. Sanc, Timestop, and TS if necessary to hit the 60+ ACs.

Being able to Scribe scrolls makes this easy enough and viable (TS in the 1st level spellslots).

ATM, the character is Wiz 4/Monk 1 (at level 5 for MS and HS skilldrop)/Ass 3.

She is pretty good, uses mundane Kamas charged with wands of GMW and Flameweapon.

She already has Ambidexterity and TWF.

Just need to pick up ITWF.

What I am not sure about, is WF, EWF, and other combat feats weighted against more magic orientated feats and Gr. Int.

In Epic, only two levels of Monk and 1 Assassin basically for skilldumps and monk speed.

Unfortunately, the CBC will not work with my OpenOffice.

I need feat optimization, to get as many as I can, in order to see what fits and what needs leaving out.

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
What is not being factored in here is DO (divine power) combined with PnP Tensor's Transformation, which on WoG basically pumps Str, DeX, BaB, etc.

This build RELIES on these two spells for combat against real opponents.

DP on WoG is majorly nerfed for non-clerics (caster level 3 on Wands and scrolls) but there are ways around that.

So, in a sense, Mick is right - it's a Mage build with Orion's insight - a spellsword.

I like the idea of Monk 6 for Impr. KD!
